posts.post_content:
@Darthparallax - I am pretty sure she cant flicker angels so she cant flicker herself. She could be a one card infinite cip combo, and that would be nuts.  
  
@LilyOola - Both angels would return at the same time and need to choose targets at the same time. When the Fiend Hunter flickers he would come back as a 'new' permanent breaking the second angel target. So the result would be a fiend hunter exiling an angel, an angel, and a champ with one extra counter.  
  
Now I have a modified version that I am pretty sure would work, but am not sure about.  
Setup: Have a [Champion of the Parish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of the Parish), a [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter) exiling a Restoration angel(Angel 1), and either a second Restoration angel(angel 2) in hand.  
1. Cast the angel, targeting the hunter with the ETB trigger.  
2. The whole instant flicker resolves, then you put both the 'return exiled creature' and 'exile a creature' triggers on the stack in that order. Target Angel 2 with the exile trigger.  
3. The exi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)   
   
FLASH
  
Flying
  
   
Then basically a phase ability!
  
   
Pulled this in the prerelease. I didn't win, but I was able to play it and the potential it has is great. Declare a block, flash it into play, keep your blocker alive, flash it in as a blocker herself. The biggest use will be "come into play" effects, but it is a good white creature.
  
   
Flash is what makes this shine.
posts.html:

Flash is what makes this shine.

posts.post_content:
@whiteshadw  
  
I found that it could also work like this:  
  
Setup:   
Any card with "Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, XXX"  
Here are some examples:  
 - [Cathars' Crusade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathars' Crusade)  
 - [Angelic Chorus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Chorus)  
  
One [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter) on the battlefield. (Doesn't have to be exiling anything)  
  
In your hand you have another [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter) and a [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel).  
  
How to do the infinite loop of creatures entering the game:  
  
First you cast the second [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter), and have it exile the first [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter) on the battlefield. Then you cast the [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel), and have it exile the second [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter). As the second [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter) leaves the battlefield, the first [Fiend Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiend Hunter) re-enters the battlefield, which you then have exile the [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel). ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@whiteshadw

I found that it could also work like this:

Setup:
Any card with "Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, XXX"
Here are some examples:
- Cathars' Crusade
- Angelic Chorus

One Fiend Hunter on the battlefield. (Doesn't have to be exiling anything)

In your hand you have another Fiend Hunter and a Restoration Angel.

How to do the infinite loop of creatures entering the game:

First you cast the second Fiend Hunter, and have it exile the first Fiend Hunter on the battlefield. Then you cast the Restoration Angel, and have it exile the second Fiend Hunter. As the second Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, the first Fiend Hunter re-enters the battlefield, which you then have exile the Restoration Angel. ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Wait? "non-angel"???  
  
WHAT?  
How is that not "except human insects, human wizards and giants, oh my" -- the only wording that makes any sense?  
  
Now snapcaster has a bigger sister that spoils him by picking him up and putting him where he wants to be.  
Freaking giants got even more evasion. Was that REALLY necessary??!?  
Where is the "destroy target mythic creature or planeswalker, or counter target mythic spell or miracle" instant?  
  
What did curse decks get in Avacyn Restored again?  
Oh. They got completely wrecked with no new curses AND an artifact DESIGNED to make curses useless.  
  
WHILE Delver and his brother Snapcaster got another tool in their toolbox.  
Not rating this card because it's Snapcaster v2 and I really don't like the potential power of the cards.  
  
It can save any creature targeted by a spell.  
It can change soulbond on your opponent's turn as a response to spells cast.  
It can give you back another Vapor Snag or Cancel or Go for the Throat, or Day of Judgment, or any other card... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

WHAT?

Now snapcaster has a bigger sister that spoils him by picking him up and putting him where he wants to be.
Freaking giants got even more evasion. Was that REALLY necessary??!?
Where is the "destroy target mythic creature or planeswalker, or counter target mythic spell or miracle" instant?

What did curse decks get in Avacyn Restored again?
Oh. They got completely wrecked with no new curses AND an artifact DESIGNED to make curses useless.

WHILE Delver and his brother Snapcaster got another tool in their toolbox.
Not rating this card because it's Snapcaster v2 and I really don't like the potential power of the cards.

It can save any creature targeted by a spell.
It can change soulbond on your opponent's turn as a response to spells cast.
